bwwExcerpt: The production never quite finds its rhythm, but Mamet's writing certainly does. He shows us the poignance and the heroism of the performing life. 'The lights dim. Each to his own home,' Robert says to himself as he leaves the theatre, in the play's last line. But, to theatricals, home is where the art is.
